result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Darnell Beal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Darnell Beal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Darnell Beal was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Court ordered NO release privileges.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with all recommended treatment, and comply with all medications.
AODA assessment and satisfactorily comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant to be tested twice per month for the first year, and then once randomly per month.  No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both. Cooperate with any job training program as referred by agent.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Complete an anger management program. Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive. STAYED. To be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Darnell Beal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Darnell Beal
Current: 216 E Locust St, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2017)
Prior: 3164 North Richards Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  08-10-2014          Initials:  AAC

Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements given by the state, defense, and the defendant.   

Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 73 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with all recommended treatment, and comply with all medications.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant to be tested twice per month for the first year, and then once randomly per month.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- Cooperate with any job training program as referred by agent.
- Complete an anger management program.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Anne Jaspers in court, defendant Christopher Darnell Beal not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $500 CASH.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #2002CF3419 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Michael Smith.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.

Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in custody.  Student Intern William Berens under the supervision of  Antonella Aleman for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Christopher Darnell Beal in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
